metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000116 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Mercurial prior to 4.3 did not adequately sanitize hostnames passed to ssh, leading to possible shell-injection attacks. It was discovered that Mercurial incorrectly handled hostnames passed to ssh. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

mercurial - 2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4
mercurial-common - 2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mercurial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4').
